intro: Galarhoeus lucorum f. latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf form of the common spurge, is a variant of a flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It is characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides or in waste areas. This form is distinguished by its wider leaf structure compared to the typical variety of the species.
